Account Relationship Manager Job at Polaris Bank Limited




        
    

        
        Polaris Bank was established by the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) on September 21, 2018 to offer commercial banking services to the Nigerian public. The bank commenced services on the same day, having purchased the assets and assumed certain liabilities of the defunct Skye Bank. With a footprint of over 350 branches across the country, Polaris Bank prides itself in delivering exceptional customer experience, leveraging best in class/state of the art Information Communication Technology (ICT).

By focusing on ICT solutions across multiple service delivery channels (mobile banking, ATMs, POS and online platforms) Polaris Bank maintains a pivotal role in the Nigerian banking industry, providing customers with simple, convenient and secured banking services.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Relationship Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full Time

About the job


	The ideal candidate will be able to appropriately identify the needs of both new and current customers in order to aid customers in their success using our product.
	This will be done by developing an appropriate level of communication with clients and internal team members to better understand and mitigate any issues the customers may face.


Responsibilities


	Work cross functionally within the company to communicate with all stakeholders in customers' success
	Create and maintain relationships with customers to better understand and achieve their needs
	Make visits to our customers to identify opportunities for growth within our platform
	Manage all reporting about the health of customers' accounts.


Qualifications


	Previous account management experience
	Articulate and well accustomed to a client facing role
	Willingness and ability to travel.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Corporate Sales Executive",
  "description": "Cloud Energy Photoelectric Ltd is a Nigerian-based Solar Energy Company that is focused on the conservation of energy and delivering its immediate needs. These conservation techniques involve utilizing Inverter Systems, Solar Energy, and the use of LED Energy-saving Lighting for the most efficient conservation of energy. At Cloud Energy, we offer exceptional after-sales support with dedicated Engineers and Client Service representatives while providing alternative energy solutions to homes, organizations, schools, industries, and more nationwide.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Corporate Sales Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job&nbsp;&nbsp;Description


	We are looking for ambitious, high-performing, extremely dogged, classy and focused Corporate Sales Executives to join our dynamic sales team in Lagos.
	The responsibilities include selling our various solar solutions and systems to leads, nurturing them and converting them to customers using several strategies and meeting sales targets.
	In this role, you will be responsible for targeting and acquiring new corporate accounts, demonstrating how our products can meet their needs and help achieve their energy goals.
	He/She will engage C-Suite Executives, heads of parastatals, directors of government bodies, senior executives and boards of directors, with the sole aim of building relationships and driving corporate sales.


&nbsp;Responsibilities&nbsp;


	Clearly communicating and selling our solar solution packages to the right market audience.
	Adopting well-researched strategies to drive sales.
	Researching prospects and generating leads.
	Making presentations remotely and physically to corporates to sell the solutions.
	Contacting potential and existing customers on the phone, by email, and in person
	Preparing excellently crafted and customised introduction letters and proposals.
	Persuade the customer to buy by demonstrating how the solar solutions meet their corporate and staff needs.
	Explain accurately the features, benefits and pricing of products and service
	Preparing and sending quotes and invoices.
	Continuous nurturing and follow-up of prospects.
	Drive customer retention and repeat patronage
	Building and maintaining a CRM database.
	Meeting daily, weekly, and monthly sales targets.

As part of a historic multi-million pound expansion of BBC Africa, the BBC World Service is introducing a wide range of new and exciting language and regional content to serve African and global audiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Reporter

Job Requisition ID:&nbsp; 34349
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Purpose of the role


	You will be part of the BBC Yoruba service team in charge of content coming from the outstation in Ibadan Oyo state.
	You will be responsible for providing adequate news coverage for the entire South-West region.
	You will also advise on the most suitable content coming from Ibadan and its environs and will brief the editor and Senior Journalists on the same.&nbsp;


Job Summary


	As a reporter, you will be responsible for originating and producing stories which may include scripting, editing, outputting, filming and presenting content across a range of BBC output or generating exciting ideas and original newsgathering.&nbsp;


Responsibilities
Day to day duties will include:&nbsp;


	Propose; research; write; report and edit interesting and well-explained reports and more thoughtful, analytical pieces for publication &ndash; meeting high journalistic standards and fully observing the BBC editorial guidelines.&nbsp;
	Alert editors to breaking news and be ready to file and present accurate, on-the-spot reports and analysis.&nbsp;
	Develop and use all formats and platforms available to tell the story in the most appropriate way, with a particular focus on digital platforms to deliver our journalism to audiences.&nbsp;
	To gather material for Yoruba service&#39;s digital platforms on news topics and events which is reflective of the audiences we serve.&nbsp;
	To provide timely, specialist and self-assured news coverage and analysis of news and events of interest to the audiences of the BBC.&nbsp;
	Maintain regular and clear communication with the Senior Journalists and Editor ensuring everyone is always briefed on own movements throughout the assignment.&nbsp;
	Delivering to tight deadlines while maintaining the highest editorial standards.&nbsp;


Your Skills and Experience
Essential Criteria


	Exceptional Editorial Judgment &ndash; Proven ability to deliver complex stories and investigations, ensuring accuracy, impartiality, and audience relevance across platforms.&nbsp;
	Excellent understanding and comprehensive knowledge of Oyo state and southwest Nigeria as well.&nbsp;
	Creative and Tenacious &ndash; A track record of generating original, high-quality journalism with the creativity and determination to see stories through from concept to completion.&nbsp;
	Experience of live broadcasting with good on-screen presence, self-assured microphone voice and ability to communicate effectively to target audience.&nbsp;
	Willingness to travel and in particular to High-Risk environments.&nbsp;
	The ability to work flexible hours when required including on weekends if necessary.&nbsp;


Specific details:


	Be a native Yoruba speaker&nbsp;
	Be able to write Yoruba fluently with right tonal marks&nbsp;
	Be based in Ibadan&nbsp;
	Have worked for media organizations based in Oyo for some years&nbsp;
	Be able to handle camera&nbsp;

	Be able to present or do two-way reporting
	If you can bring some of these skills and experience, along with transferable strengths, we&rsquo;d love to hear from you and encourage you to apply.&nbsp;


Note

	Any offer made is conditional on these checks being satisfactory.

        The BBC is an international multimedia broadcaster on radio, TV, online and social networks with a weekly global audience of 320 million. As part of a historic multi-million pound expansion of BBC Africa, the BBC World Service is introducing a wide range of new and exciting language and regional content to serve African and global audiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Reporter

Job Requisition ID:  34349
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Purpose of the role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	You will be part of the BBC Yoruba service team in charge of content coming from the outstation in Ibadan Oyo state.
	You will be responsible for providing adequate news coverage for the entire South-West region.
	You will also advise on the most suitable content coming from Ibadan and its environs and will brief the editor and Senior Journalists on the same. 


Job Summary


	As a reporter, you will be responsible for originating and producing stories which may include scripting, editing, outputting, filming and presenting content across a range of BBC output or generating exciting ideas and original newsgathering. 


Responsibilities
Day to day duties will include: 


	Propose; research; write; report and edit interesting and well-explained reports and more thoughtful, analytical pieces for publication – meeting high journalistic standards and fully observing the BBC editorial guidelines. 
	Alert editors to breaking news and be ready to file and present accurate, on-the-spot reports and analysis. 
	Develop and use all formats and platforms available to tell the story in the most appropriate way, with a particular focus on digital platforms to deliver our journalism to audiences. 
	To gather material for Yoruba service's digital platforms on news topics and events which is reflective of the audiences we serve. 
	To provide timely, specialist and self-assured news coverage and analysis of news and events of interest to the audiences of the BBC. 
	Maintain regular and clear communication with the Senior Journalists and Editor ensuring everyone is always briefed on own movements throughout the assignment. 
	Delivering to tight deadlines while maintaining the highest editorial standards. 


Your Skills and Experience
Essential Criteria


	Exceptional Editorial Judgment – Proven ability to deliver complex stories and investigations, ensuring accuracy, impartiality, and audience relevance across platforms. 
	Excellent understanding and comprehensive knowledge of Oyo state and southwest Nigeria as well. 
	Creative and Tenacious – A track record of generating original, high-quality journalism with the creativity and determination to see stories through from concept to completion. 
	Experience of live broadcasting with good on-screen presence, self-assured microphone voice and ability to communicate effectively to target audience. 
	Willingness to travel and in particular to High-Risk environments. 
	The ability to work flexible hours when required including on weekends if necessary. 


Specific details:


	Be a native Yoruba speaker 
	Be able to write Yoruba fluently with right tonal marks 
	Be based in Ibadan 
	Have worked for media organizations based in Oyo for some years 
	Be able to handle camera 
	Be able to shoot and edit videos and audio 
	Be able to present or do two-way reporting
	If you can bring some of these skills and experience, along with transferable strengths, we’d love to hear from you and encourage you to apply. 


Note


	If you were to be offered this role, the BBC will conduct Employment screening checks which include Reference checks; Eligibility to work checks; and if applicable to the role, Safeguarding and Adverse media/Social media checks.
	Any offer made is conditional on these checks being satisfactory.
